data.title: Contact DFW: Customer Service Questions and Comments
data.meta_description: Have a question or comment? Contact DFW Airport with the following information.
data.text:
We recommend you set your Prebooked Parking Online reservation for at least 3 hours prior to your originating flight and 3 hours after your return flight. This will give you flexibility to arrive early, or potentially plan for delayed/cancelled flights or unusual weather.

No, you are not able to leave and return on the same reservation.

Once you have entered through the toll gates, your reservation will be marked as completed after you exit, and re-entering the airport afterwards will result in being charged the drive-up rate for the lot you parked in.

Yes, you may make changes to your reservation up to one (1) hour in advance of your reservation start time.

Please click here to make changes to your reservation.

You may cancel your booking at any time up to one (1) hour before the beginning of your booking arrival time and receive a full refund. To do so, you can click here or click on the âModify Bookingâ link on the confirmation email and then cancel or modify.

Modifications to your reservation, such as your license plate, must be made at least 1 hour prior to your booking arrival time through the "Find My Prebooked Parking" feature on the DFW Airport Prebooked Parking site. This change can be made with no additional fee. Arriving in a vehicle different from the reservation will result in a charge at the posted parking rate.

A: Log in to your MyDFW account and navigate to âMy Parking Bookingsâ to view your reservations. Click on âManage Bookings.â If your trip has already started (and is in progress), you will see an option to Extend Parking. This option will not be available for future trips.

*The customer service center is unable to assist with these requests due to Payment Card Industry and Personal Identifiable Information compliance.

To cancel or modify a reservation, go to "Find My Prebooked Parking" or click here. You will need the confirmation number from your payment confirmation email and the email address you provided during the payment process in order to access this file.

To create a reservation, please visit the Prebooked Parking page or the DFW Airport app.

A: The âExtend Stayâ button will only appear after your scheduled arrival and before your scheduled exit. You can modify your booking before your trip starts, or you can use the âExtend Parkingâ option once your trip has started.

A: Yes. Search for your reservation using the âFind My Prebooked Parkingâ feature and enter the email used for your reservation and the Reservation Ref or Reservation ID. As long as your trip has already started, you will see an option to extend your stay.

No, please park in the terminal that is specified in the reservation. Parking in another terminal will subject you to incur additional fees. You can access all terminals through Terminal Link shuttles or Skylink. Terminal Link shuttles are designated on the curbside and Skylink can be accessed once through security.

If you had an issue when entering the airport, and took a ticket from the machine, please use the âCash Onlyâ lane to speak to an attendant and show them your prepaid parking reservation.

Otherwise, you may use any lane to enter and exit through the airport toll plazas.

Yes, we sell a limited number of spots online to ensure that customers who drive up without a prebooked reservation can still find parking.

However, all drive up customers will pay the drive-up parking rates, which can be found here under each product.

The QR code is the backup method to enter and exit through the toll plazas.

If the gates do not open automatically after a few seconds when you pull up, then please scan the QR code located in your email confirmation to enter and/or exit.

Please have your QR code that you received in your email confirmation up and ready on your phone. The toll gates should open automatically within a few seconds of you pulling up. If they do not, please scan the QR code to get through the toll gate. Do not pull a ticket.

Once you have received your booking confirmation, you can relax knowing that your parking needs are covered.

How you use your booking to enter and exit DFW Airport will depend on whether or not you have a TollTag. Instructions on use of TollTag at DFW Airport Parking are listed HERE.

If you have a TollTag on your vehicle:

Enter and exit DFW Airport as normal using the car and identical TollTag associated with your visit.

Your TollTag will be only be associated with your prebooked parking confirmation and will NOT be charged for your parking stay. Your TollTag allows you the fastest entry and exit to/from DFW Airport.

Click HERE to see a short video of how to use prebooked parking with your TollTag.

Upon entering DFW Airport, park in the parking location (Terminal or Express) that you prebook for.

If you are issued a QR Code at the time of your payment:

Enter via any lane

Stop at the entry barrier

DO NOT PRESS THE BUTTON FOR A TICKET

Scan your pre-paid confirmation QR code using the Barcode/QR code reader on the kiosk. (located on the bottom left)

The light on the QR Reader will turn green when the QR Code is read successfully.

Click HERE to see a short video of how to use your prebooked parking with your QR code.

Upon entering DFW Airport, park in the parking location (Terminal or Express) that you prebooked for.

Our promotions are limited on the quantity we sell as well as the dates that we offer the discounted rate.

If you do not see the rate, please ensure you have typed in the promotion code correctly. If you still do not see the discounted rate, then it is safe to assume that the discounted rate is not available for the dates in question.

No, you are not able to leave and return on the same reservation.

Once you have entered through the toll gates, your reservation will be marked as completed after you exit, and re-entering the airport afterwards will result in being charged the drive-up rate for the lot you parked in.

You qualify for a refund if:

You have approved specialty military license plates. Please click here for eligibility.

You prebooked a reservation but you were charged when exiting the airport (subject to review).

You parked at Grand Hyatt, Hyatt Regency or with DFW Airport Valet and you were charged when exiting the airport.

Your airline cancelled or delayed your flight.

If you qualify for a refund, please click here to request your refund and attach all relevant documents.

You do not qualify for a refund if:

You have temporary or paper tags for specialty license plates.

You were charged a Passthrough rate (driving from one end of the airport to the other).

You failed to cancel your reservation at least 1 hour before airport arrival time.

You were flying standby and did not get on your flight.

The license plate of the car you bring to the airport does not match the license plate you entered in the reservation, i.e., please bring the car that you booked.

Yes, the original reservation will be refunded. Example: The original reservation was $50, and you were charged another $65 for the modified reservation. The original $50 will be refunded within 72 hours.

If you have not received your refund in 72 hrs, please click here to request your refund.
